definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Spread some chopped onions over the fish before it's served.
sentences.chinese: 上菜之前，先在鱼上撒点剁碎的洋葱。

sentences.english: Leave to rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Ken:If you are hosting a dinner, you can serve everyone portions on their own plates.
sentences.chinese: 如果你请人吃饭，上菜时你既可以给每人盛一小盘。

sentences.english: Empty the noodles and liquid into a serving bowl .
sentences.chinese: 把汤面倒进上菜用的碗中。

sentences.english: This one is great served alongside any roasted meat.
sentences.chinese: 它同任何烤肉配在一起上菜的话非常棒。

sentences.english: The fried noodles is ready. Would mind serving now?
sentences.chinese: 炒面已经做好了，现在上菜好吗？

sentences.english: At a dinner, there's the host, the guests, and then the servants who serve.
sentences.chinese: 有坐席的主人和宾客，有端茶上菜的侍仆。

sentences.english: While waiting to be served she removed her gloves very slowly and set them beside her.
sentences.chinese: 等待上菜的时候，她将手套慢慢脱下，放在身旁。

sentences.english: It's going to be my treat today - I'll pay the bill.
sentences.chinese: 你马上上菜，今天这顿饭我包了，我请客。

sentences.english: Don't make a scene when you have to wait 30 minutes for a table.
sentences.chinese: 当你得等30分钟才上菜时，也不要显得不耐烦。

sentences.english: Dining at banquet, always serve ladies first.
sentences.chinese: 宴请就餐时，应先给女士上菜。

sentences.english: When ready to serve, reheat all the vegetables by gently tossing in butter in a sauté pan.
sentences.chinese: 当准备上菜时，在平底锅中用奶油轻轻将蔬菜加热。

sentences.english: Tell Mr. Smith we will start to serve as soon as President Houseman arrives.
sentences.chinese: 告诉史密斯先生，豪斯曼校长一到我们就开始上菜。

sentences.english: The waiters wear roller skates to serve the food.
sentences.chinese: 那里的服务员是穿着溜冰鞋上菜的。

sentences.english: Serve, the first child of a mixed lapin .
sentences.chinese: 上菜了，先上一个拌拉皮儿。

sentences.english: First last soup, almost become the decided structure and form of dinner party in Guangzhou after the last vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 先上汤，后上菜，几乎成为广州宴席的既定格局。

definition: (at a restaurant) to bring a dish to a customer/to serve food
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
food and drink/food to accompany wine
table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc
tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
